intro: Chaetanthera depauperata, commonly known as the poorflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has a slender stem with alternate leaves that are usually lance-shaped. The flowers are pale yellow to white and bloom in early spring, attracting various pollinators.
